Method Detail

addComponent

public void addComponent(HwComponent hwComponent,
                         int[] componentSlots)
Adds a child component to this component. The added component will occupy the set of slots defined by componentSlots.

Parameters:
hwComponent - The component to add.
componentSlots - The slots that the added component will occupy. This is a set of integers with length between 1 and the number of slots that the parent can hold. Each element of componentSlots should be an index to a valid slot. ie. it should be between 0 and the number of slots this page contains -1. The order of the set componentSlots matters. The first element in componentSlots corresponds to the first child slot, the second, to the second child slot etc.

addComponent

public void addComponent(HwComponent hwComponent,
                         int componentSlot)
Same as add component above but for adding a component that only has one slot.

Parameters:
hwComponent - The component to add.
componentSlot - The slot that this component will occupy.

removeComponent

public void removeComponent(HwComponent hwComponent)
Removes a child component from this component if it exists.

Parameters:
hwComponent - the component to remove.

updateChildComponent

protected void updateChildComponent(HwComponent childComponent,
                                    int childSlotToUpdate,
                                    java.lang.Object newValue)
This function gets called by a child of this HwComponent that wishes to have itself redrawn. childSlotToUpdate is the slot *in the child* that needs to be updated. This is not to be confused with the slot on this component that the child slot occupies.

Parameters:
childComponent - The child HwComponent of this HwComponent that needs to be redrawn.
childSlotToUpdate - The slot in the child that needs to be updated.
newValue - The value that should be drawn.

redraw

public void redraw()

redraw in class HwComponent
